website_summaries.verdict: The best way to enjoy the rich creamy flavor of homemade ice cream in just a fraction of the time.
pros: Makes roughly 2 quarts of ice cream at a time in 20-30 minutes
Enjoy delicious homemade ice cream quickly without the use of ice and salt
Attachment comes with a range of recipes from vanilla to cherry cheesecake ice cream
Attachment fits all KitchenAid stand mixers
cons: Mixing bowl must be stored in the freezer for 24 hours prior to use

customer_reviews.title: So Cool!
customer_reviews.text: This is such an amazing attachment for the kitchenaid mixer! I have made so many batches of ice cream this year (coffee, chocolate, black cherry chocolate chip, plum, banana cream, etc.). I don't understand the bad reviews on here and wonder if people are caring for the attachment as needed. Put it in the freezer about 24 hours before you want to use it, take it out and make your ice cream, leave it on the counter to thaw for 12-24 hours, then wash it. I've had zero problems with mine, and the ice cream recipes that come with it are fabulous :)
customer_reviews.author: sgamje50

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy...  it leaks blue fluid
customer_reviews.text: While my family and I enjoyed making ice cream with this attachment, like many others, after a couple of years (mostly just sitting in the freezer), it began leaking blue fluid. I just got off the phone with Kithenaid, and they offered me a discount on future product purchases... gee, thanks. For the half dozen or so batches of ice cream we made, it was very expensive. This thing is garbage,
customer_reviews.author: Curtis A.

customer_reviews.title: Wasted money
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used this it never got the ice cream frozen enough to be creamy. I assumed that was because I had used a low-fat recipe and the texture was funny because of the recipe. So I left the bowl in my deep freezer for the next two weeks. I made a regular batch of ice cream, held it in the fridge overnight, and went to churn it after dinner. After twenty minutes you couldn't tell it was frozen at all. When I gave up and put the cream mixture back into a regular bowl there were only a few frozen pieces in the whole bowl. What a disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: AkBrandice

customer_reviews.title: Maybe we should just get a dedicated ice cream maker?
customer_reviews.text: We have a 6 qt mixer. Chilled bowl 24 hours. Made batter. Placed drive shaft adapter on mixer. Put bowl on mixer with paddle inside. Lifted bowl with mixer lever to engage drive shaft. Turned mixer to lowest setting (stir). Drive shaft shattered instantly. Not sure what we did wrong. Paddle seemed like it could move just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Learning curve, but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I had wanted one of these for a good while. It is worth the money. You do absolutely have to keep this in the very center of your freezer. The ice cream doesn't make well if the bowl is not cold enough. You cannot make two batches in a row for that same reason. The ice cream will still be very soft; plan enough time to put it in the freezer for a while. And it does expand while freezing, so you will eventually be able to gauge how full to fill it (or try following the directions at the onset :-) ). Fill it and walk away. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Tnroses in Oklahoma

customer_reviews.title: My favorite attachment.
customer_reviews.text: Seriously my favorite KitchenAid attachment. We have a huge chest freezer so keeping it frozen all the time isn’t an issue for me. I find I don’t even buy ice cream anymore. Make sure you have all your ingredients mixed before you even take it out of the freezer. If it thaws at all it won’t work well. I like to put the ice cream in another container and put in the freezer to harden a little more. It doesn’t get very solid but it’s still fine to eat straight out of the ice cream maker. Brilliant idea. And no salt or ice to contend with.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Dove

customer_reviews.title: broke easily
customer_reviews.text: Total garbage. I am a product design engineer. It is common knowlege that PC plastic becomes brittle when cold. We used it a few times, and loved it. Loved the results, and love icecream. Then this piece of garbage cracked, and started leaking bitter blue liquid all over my freezer and pantry. and my kid tasted it because it looked yummy. I am a wimp, and have 2 ilttle girls. We definately did not abouse it. if you want to pay this much for something that lasts a couple months, be my guest. I used to think of kitechenaide as quality. This doea a lot a damage to that impression.
customer_reviews.author: S. Schiraga

customer_reviews.title: Works awesome if you follow the instructions
customer_reviews.text: Works awesome if you follow the instructions, and do not pour the mixture in before you turn on the mixer. If you pour it in before the you turn the mixer on, it will freeze to the sides, and the mixer will jam up. POUR THE MIX IN WHILE THE MIXER IS ON...., Also, allow the ice cream maker to completely dry before freezing it again to keep it from cracking or water expanding in the joints.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Bielenda

customer_reviews.title: It worked well at the beginning...
customer_reviews.text: After a handful of uses it started leaking blue liquid everywhere, I let you imagine the mess it made in my kitchen cabinets!
customer_reviews.author: Valentina Real Italian Kitchen

customer_reviews.title: Cracks And Leaks After Just A Few Uses. Save Your Money:
customer_reviews.text: Like so many others here have commented, this ice cream maker works well at first then the cracks began to show at the two side lock down locations and the blue-goo begins to flow. I returned mine with no hassles and received a new one quickly. But again, this time after only two uses, the cracks reappeared as did the flow of the blue-goo at the same places as my first one. This unit has a design flaw that KitchenAid obviously knows about but refused to address. Save your money folks and purchase a maker from a different company as this KitchenAid attachment is a piece-o-poo.
customer_reviews.author: Rick H.

customer_reviews.title: junk!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is junk! The part that hooks to your kitchenaid stand won't stay on and then strips out when you try to turn the paddle for the ice cream maker. Why wouldn't they just make the paddle attach like ALL OTHER beaters attach. It comes off in the middle of ice cream making and then strips out when starting to church again. My return window through amazon closed for this, which is a HUGE disappointment. I LOVE my kitchenaid, but this ice cream maker is junk. I would LOVE for kitchenaid to stand behind its product and return my item!!
customer_reviews.author: aby

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!!
customer_reviews.text: The plastic piece attaching the paddle snapped on my second use. I was hesitant when i saw it was plastic but it had such great reviews. But should have went with my gut. This is a horrible design. It would have been incredibly easy to make a metal ice cream paddle that attached to the existing mechanics.
customer_reviews.author: Brinley Roush

customer_reviews.title: Blue goo after 3 uses
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product, I own a lot of KitchenAid appliances and they are normally top notch. This one is an exception. After 3 uses the blue goo started leaking out. The pan was washed and stored as per the manual. Shame on me for not trusting the other negative reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Potratz

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm on my 6qt Pro-Series Lift Bowl Mixer
customer_reviews.text: This ice cream bowl fits my 6qt lift bowl mixer. I was concerned because the title specifically excludes "most 6 Quart Models". The product was easy to attach to the mixing arm and creates ice cream in about 20 minutes. We've used it 3 times under the current quarantine and it has been nice to enjoy a bowl without needing to "risk it all" at the grocery...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leaks a blue liquid
customer_reviews.text: The bowl works fine but it leaks a blue liquid, on the outer shell. It's a very slow leak; but I just took the bowl out of the shelves for the first time since last summer and there's a blue stain on the shelf with some residue on the bowl. The bowl is only 2 years old (2014 purchase), has been used moderately and we've always taken good care of it. As a matter of fact there many reviews online (maybe not on amazon) that point to the same problem. I don't know what this blue liquid is. Could it be toxic? I've had to stop using the bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Olivier Harel

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I love this attachment. It freezes evenly and creates a lovely texture in a short amount of time. I keep mine in my deep freezer in a bag until I'm ready to use it next - just make sure your freezer isnt on its absolute coldest setting or else your mixer bowl will be TOO cold and freeze your mixture on contact and it's a bit of a pain to fix. But that's just a tip, not a product flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Really Disappointing. Shame on you Kitchenaid.
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase. This made ice cream for a single time, after that we had soup. I now realize that the blue liquid floating around my freezer floor was the coolant. After reading all of the reviews, we will not replace it. It just is not worth the disappointing results. The engineering is faulty. Believe the reviews.Save your money, please.
customer_reviews.author: Fenwick Farm

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and used it happily several times the first summer. However, at some point after that it started leaking the blue freezer fluid all over. It was not cracked and I couldn't determine what the problem was. After that it wouldn't freeze the ice cream enough to work properly. This was several years ago, but as I have been thinking about ice cream, I was looking for a replacement and see that they are still selling this defective product, so wanted to write a review to warn people. I am very disappointed in KitchenAid for still selling this item.
customer_reviews.author: Music Lover

customer_reviews.title: enabling it to be flexible there for useless. Very poor design
customer_reviews.text: The attachment (9709414) that helps spins the paddle is a spring that is on a square post that should be flexible. The problem is that the square post rotated and jammed in the square fitting awkwardly, enabling it to be flexible there for useless. Very poor design!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT fit Kitchenaid Pro 6000!
customer_reviews.text: This was supposed to fit my new Kitchenaid Pro 6000. After combining the ice cream ingredients, I tried to assemble the ice cream maker. Unfortunately, the motor attachment is the not the one pictured in the Amazon description of this item. No homemade is cream for us tonight! Husband is sad......I'm mad! Will have to return.
customer_reviews.author: marshnello

customer_reviews.title: Very handy, works great
customer_reviews.text: It works so great! I can make ice cream in a flash and it tastes like soft-serve immediately after mixing or I freeze it and have dipped ice cream. I do recommend freezing it in a deep freeze, though. It gets it colder than a regular refrigerator freezer. A good buy - paid for itself in seven batches for us as we have allergies to ingredients in regular boughten ice cream. I have also used this attachment in both the small-size and extra-large size KitchenAid
customer_reviews.author: ab

customer_reviews.title: Looks used and inauthentic
customer_reviews.text: I received the ice cream maker and made the mistake of unboxing it the day before planned use. It looks used and/or inauthentic. The bowl and parts were not covered in plastic protective wrapping, which might be the case since we are all trying to reduce plastic pollution. In any case, there were fingerprint like stains inside the bowl, and the metal rim/edges at the top of the bowl had dark marks as though they had rubbed against something. Furthermore, the Kitchenaid logo is not etched properly and has some shadow markings above the letters, which does not inspire confidence that this is an authentic product. It looks like it came from the defect pile.
customer_reviews.author: Lily Ma

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I have always wanted an ice cream maker but never thought I had the room for one. After I finally purchased my first KitchenAide stand mixer I decided to give this attachment a shot because it is less bulky than an entire ice cream maker. It works wonderfully. I just made a batch of strawberry ice cream with it and it was quick and easy. The ice cream was fantastic. My favorite thing about this is that I can just leave the drum in my freezer so it takes up no extra cabinet space and it’s always ready to go if I decide to use it. Great attachment, especially for the price. I’d recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Post hoc ergo propter hoc
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a wedding gift for some friends. They are now fat and divorced. I don't blame the ice cream maker. Maybe they just spent too much time together sitting on the couch eating homemade rocky road; maybe they should have spent more time alone...
customer_reviews.author: Robbie L Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Great Attachment - Works So Well
customer_reviews.text: Follow instructions carefully. The second batch I made I dumped in some ingredients before attaching the wand/padding and the liquids quickly froze solid to the walls of the bowl, and the wand couldn't turn (it probably should have broken the wand under the force of the mixer motor, but the quality of the plastic is such that it did no damage).
customer_reviews.author: Chris Nichols

customer_reviews.title: attachment will not stay put
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this to work unfortunately the attachment to hold the paddle in place kept falling into the ice cream batter. It just didn't work for me I could not managed to keep in where it needed to be and it seemed like the paddle was going to snap. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: DRM

customer_reviews.title: Broke Immediately
customer_reviews.text: A huge disappointment, it broke immediately. The new designed adapter is a very poor design and I would not recommend this device to anyone at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Salt

customer_reviews.title: Its great for simple ice cream recipes
customer_reviews.text: If you're on a budget or don't have a lot of space in your house for another kitchen gadget, this is great. Otherwise, consider investing in an actual ice cream machine. Advice/side note: - If you're trying to make ice cream in a warm environment, you need to babysit this thing. As soon as you see condensation on the side of the ice cream attachment, you should stop mixing and try to determine whether or not you're satistifed with what it looks like. If it's too liquidy, store your mixture in the fridge, freeze the ice cream attachment and try again the next day but with maybe only about 1/2 your mixture.
customer_reviews.author: Mobgob

customer_reviews.title: They work great for the first few freezes
customer_reviews.text: They leak. They all leak. Look at reviews here and on Kitchen Aid's site. They work great for the first few freezes, but then the small "ball" that clips into your mixer will get hairline cracks around it, and leak blue fluid onto everything. Save your warranty info!
customer_reviews.author: SmokeyTheBear

customer_reviews.title: Ok for some, not for me
customer_reviews.text: I used this twice and it was fine, just follow the directions! Unfortunately while mine was stored in the freezer it was bumped and cracked then oozed blue goo all in the freezer. I didn't realize how fragile the plastic is. I'm going back to my bucket ice cream maker.
customer_reviews.author: Whatever It’s my opinion

customer_reviews.title: Need a lot of freezer room.
customer_reviews.text: It makes a very small amount which I should have realized. It sucks to have to put the bowl in the freezer for hours or overnight before you can even make it and then the ice cream is so soft you have to put it in the freezer for a couple hours after so I less you have a freezer you can always store this in, it’s not good for impromptu ice cream making.
customer_reviews.author: Plumpkin

customer_reviews.title: Great ice cream maker
customer_reviews.text: After days of research on various ice cream brands I finally picked up this kitchenAid ice cream maker. On the first try it looked a bit messy, as poring your ice cream base and then adding fruits was a bit of challenge, you need to add these while machine is actually functioning. The ice cream it made come out perfect, that no ice crystals. It was soft and delicious. With buying it, if you already have a kitchenAid mixer this is a must as on for your summer treats
customer_reviews.author: Arshad M.

customer_reviews.title: Another Granddaughter and Another Birthday Present
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my granddaughter and she loves it. She called to get grandpa's recipe for ice cream. Unfortunately, he is one of those who just pours in stuff, so I had to guesstimate, for her and I guess we did good as she said "the ice cream tasted just like grandpa's" That was what she was going for and she loves the attachment for her mixer. All it all, she was a happy birthday girl.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: love this product
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one. My kids broke my first bowl by dropping it onto the concrete floor and when I went to replace it I went for the same one since it worked so well the first time. If you have a kitchen aid mixer it makes so much sense to get this instead of a separate ice cream maker. Save some space and it is worth the money. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: cdhc

customer_reviews.title: I love this attachment
customer_reviews.text: I love this attachment! I wish it was filled with more of the liquid that does the freezing. When you follow the recipe for icecream, you will need to do half the mix at a time to get enough of a freeze before it's too warm to continue to work. I set my freezer at the coldest setting (-5F). it works fine with half batches but won't get completely frozen on a whole batch.
customer_reviews.author: Pickle CVMA

customer_reviews.title: Two units, both developed leaks
customer_reviews.text: The first one of these we bought in 2010 lasted only a few uses and developed a crack and leak in a little over a year. We bought a replacement, but now it has developed a tiny leak at the very bottom of the inside of the bowl after using it about a dozen times. Works well when it doesn't leak, but I can't recommend these due to the few number of uses you'll get before it starts leaking.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Nelson

customer_reviews.title: This is a great addition to the KitchenAid Mixer!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my dad and he really, really likes it! I am told it’s easy to use and the ice cream is great. It doesn’t make as much as the stand alone ice cream makers but this is extremely convenient. This is also great To experiment with different recipes without having to use the bulky ice cream makers. I’m so glad I got this for my dad!! I will probably eventually purchase myself one as well.
customer_reviews.author: Hurricane

customer_reviews.title: be careful
customer_reviews.text: opened freezer and found bowl leaking some kind of liquid
customer_reviews.author: Wulf Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Read the directions!
customer_reviews.text: I saw both positive and negative reviews and was nervous about ordering it. My mom ended up ordering it for me for Christmas and when it came in she decided to try it out herself. I gave her the advice I had seen from other reviewers about making sure to have it on a flat surface when you freeze it as well as making sure to leave your ice cream mixture in the fridge for a minimum of 8 hours prior to mixing and she had no problems in fact she loved it so much she ordered another one for herself!
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Defective bowl=sad baker
customer_reviews.text: Item is defective. Purchased in July and have not had 1 single batch of ice cream fully churn! Been making ice cream for 3 plus years and have had to resort to my Oyster brand ice cream maker which gets the job done EVERY TIME!
customer_reviews.author: katherine

customer_reviews.title: Love it - best ice cream ever
customer_reviews.text: I have two, but one got a crack in the plastic cover (somehow - probably dropped it) and leaked the blue stuff. It was just slow dribbles at first. thought I could use it and left it in the freezer sitting on some paper towels. Just checked it (couple years later) and the blue stuff completely soaked the paper towels. I'm buy another and will be more careful. Plastic is plastic. The other one is still fine.
customer_reviews.author: XOXOXO

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: This ice cream maker is so easy to use and easy to clean up. Just put it in the freezer overnight, put it on the mixer and fire it up, then pour the ice cream mix into it. After it's done, I simply toss the plastic parts into the dishwasher, hand wash and dry the bowl, and put it back in the freezer to get ready for the next round. BTW, look up "The Master Ice Cream Recipe" from the New York Times. It goes perfectly well with this ice cream maker.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fredrickson

customer_reviews.title: Works for me!
customer_reviews.text: Yes you need to pre-chill the bowl. Yes you need to be careful and not bang the bowl. Yes it takes up freezer space. It delivers a great consistency of ice cream, is easy to use, easy to clean, and a great value of you already own a Kitchen Aid. I've had mine for about a year and I'll be getting another so we can have several flavors at once in the freezer (make a batch of vanilla, cut it in 1/2 with 2 different mix-ins, keep rotating the bowls... happy family & neighbors!)
customer_reviews.author: HeatherCamper

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be replaced yearly
customer_reviews.text: This unit worked well for a couple of years. Now it is leaking the cooling liquid. I called KitchenAid & their warranty is good for a year. So basically this unit is not meant to last or in other words, needs to be replaced yearly. Must say I am very disappointed with KitchenAid. Others have had the same problem & some even sooner than I did, wish I had read the reviews before I bought the unit.
customer_reviews.author: COOK-A-HOLIC

customer_reviews.title: Wonder Ice Cream Maker attachment!
customer_reviews.text: I make the ice cream mixture and place the attachment in the freezer the night before. Pull out and make ice cream in 20 minutes. The time spent making the mixture and freezing the attachment is worth the wait when you taste the ice cream! After I remove all the ice cream, let thaw out, rinse and wipe clean then put away for the next time.
customer_reviews.author: darline

customer_reviews.title: Could not have asked for anything better well except to say that we had a little ...
customer_reviews.text: I used 2 cups heavy whipping cream, 1/4 c sugar, 1 cup whole milk, 1 t of vanilla. Ran on 1 for about 20 minutes then added 3 mashed up ripe bananas and ran an additional 3 or so minutes. Absolutely decadent! Brought back childhood memories (without the blisters). Could not have asked for anything better well except to say that we had a little leftover and froze it until the next night. Took out of freezer for about 5 minutes and I think it may have been even better. An awesome attachment.
customer_reviews.author: Coffeedawgs

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Easy!
customer_reviews.text: We have made two ice creams with this so far, has been extremely easy! Some of the recipes take a little bit of prep but nothing difficult, and once you get the base vanilla ice cream down you can add any flavors in that you want (and pinterest has a ton of recipes as well). Was easy to clean, makes a ton of ice cream, if you want all-natural ice cream this will save you a ton of money, store bought can be very pricey. Looking forward to trying new flavors out in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey S.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Made awesome ice cream. It won't be ice cream consistency in 15 minutes like in the directions. Still a soft serve consistency even when churned longer. It does prevent ice crystals from forming so it is smooth and delicious. Just pull it out into a container, put plastic wrap on touching the top and freeze for a couple hours. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: She loves it.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my fiancé for Christmas because she was always sending me to the store to buy ice cream. Good plan, right! Sadly no.. . Now she’s always sending me to the store to get ingredients for ice cream. Wife FTW. She absolutely loves it, and we both like the idea of homemade ice cream with no extra junk. 5 Stars. Great as always Kitchen Aid is top shelf!
customer_reviews.author: John Knight

customer_reviews.title: Thought I was missing the piece that attaches to the Kitchenaid!
customer_reviews.text: I had watched many videos and was not aware the attachment had been upgraded. After several terse emails asking about sending it I borrowed my neighbors manual ( mine was soggy wet from the UPS leaving it in the rain) anyway, it comes now with one less part and slides on. Make sure you cool the ice cream "custard" before putting it in the frozen bowl. Can't wait to pick fresh berries this summer for fruit based desserts with this!
customer_reviews.author: Shereen

customer_reviews.title: It's an adventure
customer_reviews.text: My life has changed and I have to watch not to make too much ice cream. It is so easy once I figured out how to install the device. I've made the best hazelnut ice-cream I've ever eaten in my life and an amazing strawberry ice cream. The journey of ice cream flavor discovery is wide open and I will keep trying many more flavors. But if you have no time, it is easier to just go and buy some ice-cream. I've had fruits waiting in the fridge because sometimes I would forget to buy an important ingredient, what a bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Angie H.

customer_reviews.title: My FAVORITE attachment for my mixer!
customer_reviews.text: This things does exactly what it's supposed to do...make ice cream. It comes with some recipes, and if you start to look around at other recipe books and you combine what they all teach you, you're going to make some great stuff! And you'll get fat. I'm not sure how dumb people are. They must be pretty ripe if they're breaking this thing. It clearly tells you not to use metal tools on it. As long as you follow the directions (there's a novel idea) you're going to make ice cream. Have fun, and remember my motto...The best part of cooking, is tasting!
customer_reviews.author: Sid Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth It!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this almost two years ago and it is still working fine. I make gelato at least once a week, so the durability is there (which is why I don't review products shortly after receiving them.) Definitely recommend which is why I just gave one as a gift!
customer_reviews.author: herb

customer_reviews.title: This product is advertised as fitting all mixer series, ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is advertised as fitting all mixer series, however the connector that shipped does not fit my Professional 6000 model and there is no product support. If you look at the pictures, you will see two different types of pieces connecting the mixer to the churner and they are not interchangeable. Multiple other reviews note this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have learned to make gelato with this Kitchen Aid ice cream maker. It works really well and I'm really enjoying this addition to my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie O.

customer_reviews.title: Better-Than-The-Store Ice Cream
customer_reviews.text: This makes wonderful ice cream, and there are tons of recipes and videos out there to teach you. I'm lucky enough to have friends with dairy cows, so this really comes in handy. If you're going to eat ice cream, this is the way to go. Super creamy and delicious. It firms up quite well in the freezer, to the point where it can be difficult to scoop out. Everything is all natural. There are no preservatives or additives that you don't want. Plus, it's actually fun to watch. Kids love this too.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: ice cream maker
customer_reviews.text: works great you can control ingredients for better taste and better health,especially if you are diabetic. use stevia or truvia as sweetener no calories or bad sugar reaction. you also can make sorbets sherbets ets using real fruit instead of chemicals and fillers.
customer_reviews.author: kodiak

customer_reviews.title: The bowl will leak eventually!
customer_reviews.text: As many others have experienced, my bowl developed a leak at the back part of the bowl flange that locks the bowl in place on the mixer. This occurred for no apparent reason other than the bowl was 5 years old. I just noticed a small blue puddle forming and traced it back to the bowl. I hadn't used it in over a year and it was always handled with care!
customer_reviews.author: gregg0

customer_reviews.title: Five stars for my ice cream maker
customer_reviews.text: This icecream maker is effortless, it's the baby that I've been looking for! For years I've had a kitchen aid mixer and this makes it complete... yes this is a absolute must for any cook.., it's a must for he or she.. My KitchenAid ice cream maker was a dream come true, my baby has arrived.. The bonus is, I can have organic homemade ice cream day or night summer or winter!! I'm all smiles 🤗😉 Thx R. Mattress Greenville, South Carolina
customer_reviews.author: R. Mattress

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long to get this?
customer_reviews.text: I use this to make sugar free ice cream. It really only takes about 20 minutes. If you want your ice cream firmer, just place it back in the freezer for another 10 minutes (ice cream and all) and then let it run for a couple minutes and Wa-La! Awesome, creamy ice cream
customer_reviews.author: WestCoastMom

customer_reviews.title: The best ice cream maker option if you already have a Kitchenaid
customer_reviews.text: Fits my 6qt bowl lift Kitchenaid, makes great ice cream, sorbet, gelato and frozen yogurt. Easy to clean (but not dishwasher safe). It's a little awkward to pour the base into the bowl while the dasher is turning and the bowl is lifted; make sure you use a jug with a good pour spout. The adapter that fits onto the Kitchenaid is a little picky, it only goes on one way round (varies depending on mixer model) and doesn't grip well. That isn't a problem as it's really only needed to hold until the dasher is in place, for that the little rubber friction fingers do an OK job.
customer_reviews.author: ChoccyHobNob

customer_reviews.title: I love knowing what is in my ice cream!
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this Nov 26 and have made so many batches of ice cream already I make single servings so the ice cream gets done really fast in like 15 min. Its really easy to use and set up and I have read reviews about the blue stuff leaking out so im making sure to wash it in cool water only after its been sitting out and the inside stuff is back to liquid. I see myself using this A LOT so I will update this review if anything bad happens
customer_reviews.author: Joshua and Michele

customer_reviews.title: WELL
customer_reviews.text: THE PRODUCT IS WORTH THE PRUCE, AND ITS A GREAT ICE CREAM MAKER, BUT THE DESIGN FOR HOW TO GET IT TO LATCH WHEN YOUR TRYING TO MAKE THE ICE CREAM IS BAD. THE GRIPS ON THEM DONT HOOH UP UNTIL SEVERAL DISTURBIBG TRYS, IT SOUNDS AS IF ITS ABOUT TO BREAK IT I CAN GET IT RIGHT. AND THE PART ALONE TO REPLACE COSTS AS MUCH AS THE WHOLE THING TOGETHER. THATS ONLY MY SAD PART OF IT..
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Cavener

customer_reviews.title: Awesome made easy!
customer_reviews.text: I have come to believe you should not own a KitchenAid mixer without owning one of these as well. I never knew making ice cream could be so easy! I keep mine in the freezer at all times so that I am able to make ice cream whenever the mood hits me. It's easy to make, easy to clean up, and comes at a great price point. I don't think I will ever buy store bought ice cream ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Dickers

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, awesome, awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Works AWESOME! Don't fill with 2qts of liquid unless you have a spatula ready to scoop-up the overflow as the ice-cream expands. Head drive-attachment is a little wonky to assemble at first and isn't really held-in by anything other than pressure, but it does work. You probably have to have a chest-freezer like we do to store this, unless you don't plan to have much else in your upright fridge's freezer.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: Used ours twice before it started leaking blue liquid all over my cupboards. It's a slow leak, so it took me a while to figure out where it was coming from. It looks like Windex spilled on my shelves. I haven't tried to use it since... kind of afraid that the blue stuff is toxic! Plan on having to freeze it for a while before you use it, and on having it use a fair amount of freezer space. It did make good ice-cream though!
customer_reviews.author: Looeybee

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyed by all
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift to add to accessories for a Kitchenaid mixer for a friend. Each year I add one. This was very much enjoyed by my friends and their grandkids. Simple to use, stores in the freezer for the next use.
customer_reviews.author: Armommi

customer_reviews.title: Will not fit Artisan Mini, Need to be made clear
customer_reviews.text: Seller needs to better communicate that this attachment will not work with the Artisan Mini series models.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Mandell

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine, very simple to use
customer_reviews.text: Got it for a gift for my wife and she was excited to use and am happy to say that it worked well and made some great ice cream. There is no mess compared with the rock salt method of making ice cream. It takes a good 8 hours of chilling inside a freezer before you use it, and then maybe 25-30minutes of churning. Can't wait to mix in some Oereo cookies in!
customer_reviews.author: SLC Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Purchased 2, Both Came Damaged.
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to try this product but I did not get a chance because the first one came damaged. When I exchanged it for another one, the second was damaged in the exact same way. This rim of the bowl is scraped like it has been used or was put together incorrectly at the factory.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Pass, not effective
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work that well. The whole idea that you freeze a bowl, and use in open air... In the South... Even during winter it could not maintain the coldness long enough to reach soft serve Savage effectively.
customer_reviews.author: christopher mee

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase of the summer
customer_reviews.text: Being stuck home all summer; this was a great purchase. Great family activity to make different flavors and get creative to make dairy free, keto , fresh fruit ice cream, gelato. It has held up well and we just love it. Several friends have put it on their wish list for birthday / Christmas presents.
customer_reviews.author: Scott L

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This product is not market ready. I have used kitchenaid for years and it has hardly ever disappointed me. That is until not. The parts do not line up. It is hard to assemble. The bowl is great. The suggestion to store it in the freezer so it is always ready is also great. But it all stops there. Not what I am use to from kitchenaid.
customer_reviews.author: vaughn minnis

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Barely freezes the ice cream but it will still come out okay once freezing in your own freezer. Works worse than the ice/salt method.
customer_reviews.author: CodonAUG

customer_reviews.title: Love it and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Love it and easy to use. Recipes given made the best ice cream. I am making ice cream for family and friends almost on a daily basis. They love it and here comes the next one asking me to make them some. Once you have set up the machine, bowl and attachment mixing pieces, make sure you lock the mixer in place before turning it on. This seems to assure a tight fit and avoid the attachment mixing pieces from coming apart.
customer_reviews.author: N. Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. I bought the product and the one which ...
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. I bought the product and the one which came is not the one shiwn in the picture. It has a different device to attach to the Kitchen Aid and it broke the second time I used it. I actually investigated and it has a lot of bad reputation so I guess they eventually changed it. I now believe I lost my money.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Y.

customer_reviews.title: It makes the creamiest ice cream ever!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to use to make ice cream instead of buying it in the store and I am so pleased! I didn't even know they made ice cream machines where you didn't have to buy 2 lbs. of ice and rock salt to make it! This is super easy you just can't make it on a whim. You have to let it sit in the freezer for about 24 hours. My favorite flavor so far is definitely blueberry! I made enough to fill the ice cream maker about halfway and it was done in less than 20 minutes! Definitely worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Quaid Strickland

customer_reviews.title: I might need to buy another one...
customer_reviews.text: I have used this ice cream maker to make lots of batches of home-made ice cream, and it has performed well for me. Now that I have made home-made ice cream, it's hard to go back to store brand ice cream - because nothing tastes as fresh as ice cream you just made yourself. My only wish is that I had two of these attachments so I can make more ice cream; but it's probably for the best, because I need to lose weight anyway!
customer_reviews.author: Chris S.

customer_reviews.title: Broke within 5 minutes!
customer_reviews.text: I followed the manufacturer instructions to assemble the battle and spring connector piece. I even watched a video to ensure that I did it correctly. The spring piece broke right in half the minute I turned the mixer on the lightest speed. Way beyond disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely impressed and very happy!!! Raspberry coconut milk ice cream.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because my daughter is dairy allergic, so it was a way for us to make her ice cream using almond, coconut or rice milk and saving money from buying the expensive dairy free ice cream. I have to say I am overly impressed and she loves experimenting and making her own ice cream. It is a hit!!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great investment
customer_reviews.text: Having allergy to Dairy it is a blessing to have this attachment to make non-dairy ice cream at home! Depending on the recipe some were firm enough to eat right after mixing and some had to go into the freezer for few hours to tighten up. For small batches of ice cream it is a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: BdRobinson

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Used only once , second time didn’t work I am returning it the attachment doesn’t work well with 600 pro I am not sure why they build it this way it could be much better and easy design
customer_reviews.author: ALEN

customer_reviews.title: Great birthday present
customer_reviews.text: Bought this attachment for my hubby' s birthday cause he loves ice cream. We have made 3 batches in 2 weeks and it has been a hit with the whole family. They like the soft serve consistency. It even stays soft in the freezer and doesn't turn rock hard like homemade ice cream. We have followed the directions and have no problems. We are pleased with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Penny Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Love homemade ice cream
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Love homemade ice cream. Years ago I made the mistake of putting whole strawberries in the mix and they came out like strawberry ice cubes. I learned then to smash up the fruit before freezing the mixture. KitchenAid makes some wonderful attachments for their mixers and this is certainly one worth having.
customer_reviews.author: the family hillbilly

customer_reviews.title: Great product and value!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a really nice addition to our mixer. We have used it a few times. It is easy to put together and easy to clean! In addition the price was reasonable for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Phelps-Roper

customer_reviews.title: I bought this attachment as my grandkids and I like making ice cream
customer_reviews.text: I bought this attachment as my grandkids and I like making ice cream. I love my kitchen Aid and this attachment works great, but,please remember to start your Kitchen Aid churning BEFORE adding your ice cream to churn so that the bowl doesn't freeze the attachments into place!
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Goodman

customer_reviews.title: Toddler Icecream Time
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to make icecream with my toddler and he really enjoyed watching it! It's easy to use and for the novice icecream maker it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Dianna

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I have used it twice, and it has worked great each time. The only annoyance is having to wait for it to thaw out to clean to refreeze.
customer_reviews.author: ChocolateSushi

customer_reviews.title: Sorbet is still a challenge but ice cream (especially following the Ben and Jerry's sweet cream base recipe) is a breeze and ext
customer_reviews.text: It's pain to have to store in the freezer since it takes up so much room but once you get the hang of it it works very well. Sorbet is still a challenge but ice cream (especially following the Ben and Jerry's sweet cream base recipe) is a breeze and extremely tasty. The included instruction guide is a bit of a joke, though, and the estimated times that it says things should take are usually way off for me.
customer_reviews.author: David R

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to make homemade ice cream with my kids and it woks great. I store it in the freezer and pull it out whenever we make ice cream. Easy to use and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany J

customer_reviews.title: Homemade ice cream a breeze
customer_reviews.text: Homemade ice cream is a dream. This bowl and attachments are easy to use and clean. We keep the bowl in the freezer all the time so we can use it whenever. Only wish the instruction manual included more recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Gadd

customer_reviews.title: Why Did I Wait So Long?
customer_reviews.text: I made my first batch of ice cream using Junket brand vanilla ice cream mix. It turned out perfectly. Operation is a breeze. I hope it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Robert STLTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not as sturdy as expected but it made great ice cream
customer_reviews.text: I would expect a Kitchen Aid product to be a bit sturdier, all but the bowl seems a bit flimsy. After looking up the instructions online we were finally able to make it work. The ice cream was wonderful, and now that I have figured out how to set it up we will be using the ice cream maker a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase yet!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best products we have purchased from Amazon! Bought it for our entrepreneurial 8 year old and she creates using this mixing daily.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I received for Mother's Day and love it. I have made ice cream twice already and both times the ice cream has been great. I followed the directions exactly and have not had any problems. My husband wants chocolate next time. The only thing I see wrong with this maker is that we are probably going to gain weight!
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Great but short lived
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item in November 2019 and have used it 5 or 6 times. It has been hand washed and well cared for. It has never been dropped. When I froze it to use last night, it formed a crack on the bottom curve of the bowl. As the ice cream was freezing, the blue gel leaked out.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh

customer_reviews.title: WASTE OF MONEY!!!
customer_reviews.text: Why does Kitchenaid even sell this!?! It does not work at all. We've tried making ice cream several times and it NEVER freezes. What a waste of money!!! If you're looking for a good ice cream maker this is not it! The Cuisinart Ice Cream/Frozen Yogurt machine for $60 is a MUCH BETTER buy and makes GREAT ice cream. So disappointed in Kitchenaid for continuing to have this worthless product on the market!!!
customer_reviews.author: abirg

customer_reviews.title: Too soft to eat when finished.
customer_reviews.text: This was something I wanted really bad but it took a couple of batches to figure out how it makes the ice cream. It comes out very soft , soft-serve. I followed several recipes in the booklet that came with it and was disappointed that I couldn't immediately eat the ice cream. You have to pour it into containers and put in freezer to freeze before it is at eating consistency. But this is how most of these ice cream makers make ice cream today. It isn't like the old hand cranked ice cream. Glad it fits my KitchenAid.
customer_reviews.author: Crabhappy

customer_reviews.title: It works great and it's very high quality!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fun and it works! Only one problem...its requires plan ahead overnight freezer storage or takes up valuable freezer storage space and it is not small! We keep it in the freezer and it's fun for spontaneously deciding to make ice cream on the fly especially with grandchildren. Worth the spend.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra L. Cassidy

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: It makes ice cream, has a recipe book with 5 items of a great variety, and is very easy to use and clean. No scrubbing necessary or recommended. Fantastic stuff.
customer_reviews.author: dzero

product_meta.title: KitchenAid Ice Cream Maker Attachment - Excludes 7, 8, and most 6 Quart Models
product_meta.description:
Color:fits 5 and 6 quart mixersMake up to 2 quarts of fresh ice cream, sorbet and a variety of other frozen desserts quickly and easily with theKitchenAid Ice Cream Maker. (Fits all Household Stand Mixers 4.5 Quart and larger.) For everything you want to make. KitchenAid.

BRAND STORY
By KitchenAid
feature_bullets: Makes up to 2.0 quarts of ice cream, gelato or sorbet in 20-30 minutes.
Dasher rotates inside the bowl to spread, scrape and mix thoroughly.
Easy to clean with warm soapy water.
Some tilt-head models will require the adapter ring to fit properly. First, attach the freeze bowl adapter ring to the bottom of the freeze bowl with a counterclockwise turn
For use with KitchenAid stand mixers; includes freeze bowl, dasher and drive assembly
Creates up to 2 quarts of ice cream, frozen yogurt, or sorbet in about 25 minutes
Powered by stand mixer; pour in batter and dasher and freeze bowl do the work
Dishwasher-safe dasher, drive assembly, and adapter ring; handwash freeze bowl
Measures 10-8/9 by 10-2/7 by 10-2/7 inches; 1-year hassle-free replacement warranty

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars4,403 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
